qas.question: How many mayors has Detroit had?
Who was Detroit's last Republican mayor?
Who was Detroit's first black mayor?
What was Dennis Archer's former occupation?

context: Beginning with its incorporation in <a0_0>1802<a0_0/>, Detroit has had a total of <a1_0>74<a1_0/> mayors. Detroit's last mayor from the Republican Party was <a2_0>Louis Miriani<a2_0/>, who served from 1957 to 1962. In 1973, the city elected its first black mayor, <a3_0>Coleman Young<a3_0/>. Despite development efforts, his combative style during his five terms in office was not well received by many suburban residents. Mayor Dennis Archer, a former Michigan <a4_0>Supreme Court Justice<a4_0/>, refocused the city's attention on redevelopment with a plan to permit three casinos downtown. By 2008, three major casino resort hotels established operations in the city.
